Selected Answer: A
It is talking about the CUCM default settings not the region to region settings

Regions Overview

When you configure the maximum audio bit rate setting in the Region Configuration window (or use the service parameter in the Service Parameter Configuration window), this setting serves as a filter. When an audio codec is selected for a call, Unified Communications Manager takes the matching codecs from both sides of a call leg, filters out the codecs that exceed the configured maximum audio bit rate, and then picks the preferred codec among the codecs that are remaining in the list.

questions.question_text: How does traffic policing respond to violations?

choices.D: It guarantees bandwidth for user-defined traffic classes.
choices.A: It allocates an equal share of bandwidth to each flow.
choices.C: It ensures that critical traffic queues are serviced first.
choices.B: It applies strict priority to user-defined traffic classes.
choices.E: It places traffic into one of four queues.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
Its C and E
Its B & C

Selected Answer: CE
"PQ gives priority queues absolute preferential treatment over low priority queues; important traffic, given the highest priority, always takes precedence over less important traffic. Packets are classified based on user-specified criteria and placed into one of the four output queues--high, medium, normal, and low--based on the assigned priority."
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/qos_conmgt/configuration/xe-16-5/qos-conmgt-xe-16-5-book/qos-conmgt-oview.html

Selected Answer: BC
I think B & C are correct

Selected Answer: CE
Definitely C and E. It's the definition of Priority Queueing (PQ).

Priority Queueing (PQ) allows you to define how traffic is prioritized in the network. You configure four traffic priorities. You can define a series of filters based on packet characteristics to cause the router to place traffic into these four queues; the queue with the highest priority is serviced first until it is empty, then the lower queues are serviced in sequence.
It seems that B, C, and E are correct. Anyone has the only 2 the exam considers to be correct?

C and E are the correct answer

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/qos_conmgt/configuration/xe-16-5/qos-conmgt-xe-16-5-book/qos-conmgt-oview.html#:~:text=to%2064%20classes-,4%20queues,-Kind%20of%20Service

Which IP precedence value maps to DSCP EF?

discussion.content:
Express Forwarding (EF) precedence 5

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/quality-of-service-qos/qos-packet-marking/10103-dscpvalues.html

Selected Answer: D
*IP precedence value 5 (DSCP EF) corresponds to the range of DSCP bits 101000 through 101111, or 40-47. However, only the value 101110 or 46 is commonly used and is given the EF designation.

questions.question_text: Which approach is taken to implement CAC within Cisco UCM in full-mesh topology?

discussion.content: Correct answer is C

Selected Answer: C
Cisco Unified Communications Manager also supports Resource Reservation Protocol (RSVP), an additional CAC mechanism that offers additional capabilities for full-mesh network topologies.
